at harvey mudd college (hmc) & the claremont colleges (5cs)

class of 2023 president (hmc)

october 2019 - present

I represent the HMC Class of 2023 as a member of the Associated Students of Harvey Mudd College (ASHMC).

I attend weekly ASHMC Senate meetings to make decisions benefiting the HMC student body, organize events for class unity, help integrate the Class of 2023 into the Claremont community, and foster relationships with professors.

I'm happy to be in a position where I can positively impact my school community and form meaningful connections with others.

women in computer science officer (5c)

september 2019 - present

As an officer for the Claremont colleges' Women in Computer Science organization, I help women at the 5Cs find opportunities in computer science.

This involves interfacing with companies and organizing events like information sessions, workshops, and professor dinners.

I planned a highly successful HackerRank and Technical Interview Workshop for women to learn about the technical hiring process and how to approach coding challenges and technical interviews. 40 students attended.

society of women engineers (hmc)

september 2019 - present

I am a member of the Society of Women Engineers (SWE) at HMC. We advocate for women interested in becoming engineers.

I actively attend SWE events, like information sessions with companies, technical workshops, panels, socials, and dinners, so that I can get to know other passionate female tech students at HMC and find new opportunities to grow as an engineer.

the student life newspaper (5c)

news & opinions editor

september 2019 - present

I am a News Editor and an Opinions Editor for The Student Life newspaper of all seven Claremont Colleges.

As a News Editor, I've been covering college reopening plans amid the coronavirus pandemic, disseminating vital information to the Claremont community, in a timely manner.

As an Opinions Editor, I solicit and edit guest op-eds. Writing for Opinions allows me to shed light on important issues in my community and work toward improving student life.

For instance, after I wrote an article about the benefits of multi-factor authentication, Scripps College began implementing a multi-factor authentication system for students and faculty, and cited my article. I have also written about mental health and student wellbeing at HMC. In my first year, I wrote 15 Opinions articles.

Read my articles for The Student Life here.

the muddraker newspaper (hmc)

editor-in-chief

september 2019 - present

I'm the Editor-in-Chief of HMC's The Muddraker newspaper. I write, edit, design, and take photos for The Muddraker, and I love being able to capture stories in my community.

As Editor-in-Chief, I've led the redesign of the publication's website, and the revamping of all its online platforms.

One of my favorite stories to date was one that I wrote about an 81-year-old auditor in my introductory CS class. I met him at a tutoring session for that class, and I'm thankful to have gotten to know him through interviews and wonderful conversations. He has many lessons to share, and I was glad to have the opportunity to tell his story.

In March 2020, when we had to leave campus due to COVID-19, we were in the final stages of production. I pushed hard to complete 10 pages of design in just a few days, in the hopes of bringing some cheer to Mudd community members through the newspaper.

Visit The Muddraker online here.

Take a look at my design and photography tabs to see some of my work for The Muddraker and other organizations.

humans of mudd (hmc)

creator

february 2020 - present

After talking to a dining hall worker one Sunday, I was inspired to create a Humans of New York-style page for my college to spread positivity and spark meaningful conversations by highlighting individuals in the Mudd community.

To date, I've conducted 30+ interviews with students, faculty, and staff on topics such as coronavirus, as well as my interviewees' hobbies, passions, and dreams.

I did all the design work for the Humans of Mudd logo and cover photo. Before the coronavirus pandemic, I took photos of all my interviewees.

Check out the Humans of Mudd website here.

You can also find Humans of Mudd on Facebook. and Instagram (@humansofmudd).

Read a feature on Humans of Mudd from The Student Life.

tour guide (hmc)

january 2020 - present

I am a tour guide for the HMC Office of Admissions. I lead weekly tours of my college to introduce prospective students to HMC.

I love HMC, and I enjoy being a tour guide because I can provide visitors with more insight into my college's position as a STEM-focused liberal arts college, and its collaborative community. I extend my enthusiasm for meeting new people to my job as a tour guide, making visitors feel welcome during their time at Mudd.

It's also a great way to practice the handy skill of walking backward and to get some extra steps in each week!

claremont climbing team (5c)

september 2019 - present

I'm an active member of the Claremont colleges' rock climbing team. When I started college, I wanted to try new things, get out of my comfort zone, and challenge myself. Climbing was the perfect way for me to do that.

My team focuses on bouldering, which is a type of rock climbing where we don't use any equipment, save for climbing shoes. As someone who easily becomes afraid, when I'm at the top of a wall and need to come back down, I sometimes wonder why I chose this activity.

Climbing isn't easy, but it's pretty amazing to be able to do things that you never thought you could do. Each climb is a problem: how do I start, what are the best holds to use, and where should I put my hands and feet each step of the way up?

club tennis (5c)

september 2019 - present

I've played tennis since elementary school, and I haven't lost my love for the sport. I played tennis for my school all four years of high school and was captain of the varsity team in my senior year. Upon entering college, I joined the club tennis team of the Claremont colleges.

I love being out at the courts and hitting with my teammates and friends. When I'm on the court, I feel at peace. Nothing matters but the next ball to hit. I can forget about everything except the game, which requires focus and strategy to be played well.

Club tennis is a great way for me to relax and get some exercise, while making friends with students from all the Claremont colleges.
